content:
LOINC oddity with IGP:

Any idea why IGP tells me that https://loinc.org/80358-5/ is

The code "80358-8" is not valid in the system http://loinc.org; The code provided (http://loinc.org#80358-8) is not valid in the value set 'All codes known to the system' (from http://tx.fhir.org/r4) for 'http://loinc.org#80358-8'

The terms appears to be not new….

Reference: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/vrdr/branches/codedcontent/qa-tx.html#l22

@Rob Hausam
well -8 is not valid.. but I think you mean -5 which is valid
the error says you tried -8... but your text says you asked for -5
Thanks @John Moehrke it's been a long day.
Saul Kravitz has marked this topic as resolved.
Saul Kravitz has marked this topic as unresolved.

Actually, @John Moehrke ...
I'm getting errors on this LOINC code where it appears that I've gotten it right:
https://loinc.org/80626-5/

The code "80626-5​" is not valid in the system http://loinc.org; The code provided (http://loinc.org#80626-5​) is not valid in the value set 'All codes known to the system' (from http://tx.fhir.org/r4) for 'http://loinc.org#80626-5​'

What am I doing wrong with this one? THX
it's not obvious - that code is valid according to tx.fhir.org
